pages.name: Child Support
pages.description:
Child support is the amount of money a parent or guardian pays to another parent or guardian to help care for the child. A child has the right to be supported by both parents, whether the parents ever lived together, or the parent has ever lived with the child.

Although parents have the primary responsibility to pay child support, other guardians and step-parents may be responsible for paying child support. If you are a step-parent, and you need more information about step-parents and child support, see the fact sheet Step-parents Rights and Responsibilities by Legal Aid BC.

For more information about child support and referrals to other child support resources, visit the BC Government website at www.gov.bc.ca.

elements.name: GuardianTypeSelectionHelp
elements.html:
Select the option that best describes the relationship you and the other party have to the child or children the application for child support is about.
If there is more than one child the application is about, and the relationship to each child is different, you can select more than one option.

choices.text: A parent or guardian of the child(ren)
Applying to be appointed as a guardian of the child(ren)
A parent or guardian of the child(ren)
A person standing in the place of a parent to the child(ren)

elements.title: You are required to file a Financial Statement in Form 4 with your application for an order about child support. You will be reminded to include a copy at the end of the service.
